title: Mammoth Cave National Park: Other Invertebrates (corals, sponges, worms, etc.)
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Animals     Other Invertebrates (corals, sponges, worms, etc.)                Other Invertebrates (corals, sponges, worms, etc.)         Planaria in a cave stream   Common organisms living within the sediments of Mammoth Cave streams are nematodes or roundworms (undescribed), copepods (Maraenobiotus, Moraria, Nitocra, and Parastenocaris), tardigrades (Macrobiotus), and oligochaete worms (Aeolosoma).
